title: Aurora Keyboard program.
body:
So, My friend recently told me about this program called Aurora that has a lot of cool add-ons for certain keyboards that have to do with the lighting. One of the things is a row of keys, so say 1-9 will show how much hp you have with the lights. I wanted to know if this was allowed or not. It says this when setting it up.
"This should not trigger any anti-cheat, as this uses natively supported LightFX support, but it is still used at your own risk"
I just wanted to double check to make sure i was okay to use this.
Thank you

replies.body:
As with any program not written by Riot Games, using anything that could *potentially* give you a competitive advantage is **use at your own risk territory**. It's impossible for me to give you a 100% for sure answer, as I didn't write the program you're referencing and I don't know if it has any *hidden features*. If you're feeling sketchy about it, it's best not to use it, but you'll need to ensure you're familiar with our [**official stance on third-party apps**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848-Third-Party-Applications).

Let me know if you have any questions.

So i don't get a warning if it is something bad right? Its just a perma ban? I want to use this program cause it has cool features in general. Like you can make it show your CPU and Ram usage on the keyboard. But i just don't want to be banned from league.
